author: Peter Poliwoda
comment: Wanted a quick working app that runs on my Android Wear watch before a presentation at work, so after it didn't do anything I promptly uninstalled it. Once I got home I tried it again and after some research it's got it to work!  I got confused at the beginning, because I didn't know that it uses Apple Script. It would be worth mentioning that and that you can get a dictionary for any app on a Mac (Google 'Spotify AppleScript dictionary'  for more details). Still trying to figure out how to display a toast after clicking the info question mark. Any thoughts?   It would be great if you could add support for the most commonly used apps like Spotify, Keynote, Powerpoint in the app out of the box (tweakable to change the default settings).  The direct Bluetooth connection would be handy too.   In general it's a great idea. Love the app! Keep up the good work! We, the people, are out there wanting more!

author: Shanthoshkanna Yohalingam
comment: Please someone tell me what's that username and password and IP address?

reply.author: hcpl
reply.content: Hi this is part of the settings of your mac system. When yo go into preferences and into sharing you'll be able to enable remote login. You can then log in with the users from that system.

title: I don't know how to connect

author: Huy Ly
comment: Make sure Remote Login is checked in the Sharing section of System Preferences.  Description should specify this or at least have it in a guide upon initial setup, I was about to give it a low rating when I thought to check my sharing settings, lucky I did because the app actually works rather well.
title: If it doesn't work turn on Remote Login under Sharing in System Preferences

author: Nisan Danışman
comment: I had to find out about AppleScript commands to be able to use it PowerPoint. I had not dabbled in this before so, it took some looking up, but then I got it to work. Now it's great, but I wish it had bluetooth support for "no wifi" situations, like presentations at clients' offices (with no network connection).

reply.author: hcpl
reply.content: Hi thank you for your feedback. The bluetooth suggestion is a good one. However technically I rely on an ssh connection so my implementation requires a true network connection.
